page.title: 06Housing in Warsop.
page.content: The{oldest}stone buildings are sited near the river crossings and at main road junctions. { Around 1900}mines were sunk and colliery companies built terraced homes for employees. { Before 1939}the Council only built 150 houses,others were built by the N.C.B.After the war the Council built traditional,semi-detached,brick houses and bought some N.C.B.houses,for the growing population. { The past 25 years}have seen the growth of private estates on the outskirts,redevelopment in the centre, and purpose-built complexes for the elderly. { In recent years}Government has encouraged some tenants to buy their Council houses,reducing the number of rented properties available.Some regard this as a cause for concern.
